definition: chess/chess-like game/a game of chess/CL:盤|盘[pan2]/chess piece/CL:個|个[ge4],顆|颗[ke1]

sentences.english: However, there is not a new kind of chess and chess the two comparable?
sentences.chinese: 然而有沒有一種新的棋藝與兩大棋藝相媲美？

sentences.english: However, there is not a new kind of chess and chess the two comparable?
sentences.chinese: 然而有沒有一種新的棋藝與兩大棋藝相媲美？

sentences.english: My chess has improved a lot.
sentences.chinese: 我的棋藝有了很大的提高。

sentences.english: If we are able to learn, it we'll just increase the level of our mastership .
sentences.chinese: 如果我們能夠掌握它，是有利於提高棋藝的。

sentences.english: He's just too good at chess – countless people have lost to him.
sentences.chinese: 他的棋藝實在太高，多少人敗在他的手下。

sentences.english: He always feels like a sovereign descending to the world in front of the chess board.
sentences.chinese: 小明精通棋藝，面對棋盤他總有種君臨天下的感覺。

sentences.english: My chess ability was roughly at the limit.
His skill in chess is unmatched in the school.
sentences.chinese: 他的棋藝在全校是獨一無二的。

sentences.english: France and China Law edge below Yamamoto examine the characteristics of chess.
sentences.chinese: 法華律邊下邊仔細觀察山本棋藝的特點。

definition: fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
to write a book advancing one's theory (idiom)
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
magnificent army with thousands of men and horses (idiom); impressive display of manpower/all the King's horses and all the King's men
to recruit talent/to round up/to enlist the services of sb
to comment/a point by point commentary
writing on the ground with a large brush dipped in water
lit. to cross five passes and slay six generals (idiom)/fig. to surmount all difficulties (on the way to success)
pinyin: guo4 wu3 guan1 zhan3 liu4 jiang4

definition: lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
